title: What do former Vice Presidents do after they leave office? - Quora
tags: Presidents of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Naturally former Presidents receive a lot more attention than Vice Presidents. That doesn't mean Vice Presidents are inactive. Joe Biden was recently in the news for starting a PAC. This allows him to fund Congressional candidates and keeps speculation alive that he may run in 2020. He will be 78 years old which works against him. Al Gore wrote a book and movie called “An Inconvenient Truth” which made him one of the world's foremost climate change spokesman. He won an academy award and the Nobel Peace Prize. Dick Cheney returned to his old job as Prince of Darkness and made Dan Quayle disappear.

SOME return to semi-private Life ( like Walter Mondale ). A few go on to champion important Social Causes ( like Al Gore & his Climate Change initiatives ). And then there are the outliers- like Dick Cheney, who go back to their Home States, & publicly throw nasty media brickbats -at Anyone who dares comment about the miserable years He was Vice President.
